definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: That China can not afford to help this football fools your eye into the affirmative.
sentences.chinese: 認爲中國足球這個扶不起的阿斗肯定不入您的慧眼。

sentences.english: But passion is an emotion that blinds you.
sentences.chinese: 但是，激情卻會遮住你的慧眼，誤導你的判斷。

sentences.english: He is a very perceptive young man.
sentences.chinese: 他是個獨具慧眼的年輕人。
獨特的時尚，獨具慧眼的您。

sentences.english: Lord Hertford’s reputation as a discerning, major collector was secured.
sentences.chinese: 赫特福德勳爵獨具慧眼的大收藏家聲譽從此開始確立。

sentences.english: He observes the sons of men; his eyes examine them.
Learning is the eye of the mind.
Since I have acquired the wisdom eye, I have not heard of such a sutra.
sentences.chinese: 我從昔來所得慧眼，未曾得聞如是之經。

sentences.english: The antique dealer has an unerring ability to spot a fake.
sentences.chinese: 那古董商慧眼識珠，鑑別假貨從不出錯。

sentences.english: Baekeland recognized a killer ap when he saw one. If only he could come up with a synthetic substitute for shellac.
sentences.chinese: 貝克蘭獨具慧眼，他迫切希望找到紫膠的合成替代物。

sentences.english: A good eye for smites is far more important than a knowledge of strategical principles.
sentences.chinese: 尋得突襲的慧眼比戰略的原則更爲重要。

sentences.english: He had a fine eye for monumental architecture.
sentences.chinese: 哈德良對紀念物的建築獨具慧眼。

sentences.english: The key is whether researchers have unique talents and the force of theory penetration.
sentences.chinese: 關鍵在於研究者是否別具慧眼，是否具有理論穿透力。

sentences.english: Be affirmative with unerring intuition for his booming business tactics.
sentences.chinese: 慧眼識人，知人善任，經營有道，生意興隆。

sentences.english: Applicants should have an eye for detail.
sentences.chinese: 申請者對細節應該獨具慧眼。

sentences.english: The French king to marry him eye know, married to Queen's test Dili Ya.
sentences.chinese: 前來求婚的法蘭西國王慧眼識人，娶考狄利婭爲皇后。

definition: lit. seeing clearly the downy feathers of autumn (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. perceptive of even the finest detail
to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
sb with preternaturally good hearing (in fiction)/fig. a well-informed person
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
